main.docTitle:
Disaster Relief Fund
Resolution of the Legislative Council
main.text: Resolution made and passed by the Legislative Council under section 29 of the Public Finance Ordinance (Cap. 2) on 1 December 1993.
main.leadIn: Resolved that, with effect from 1 December 1993, the Disaster Relief Fund is established to provide aid in relief of disasters that occur outside Hong Kong on the following terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary is the administrator of the Fund and he may delegate his power of administration to other public officers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Disaster Relief Fund Advisory Committee shall be appointed by the Chief Executive to advise the Financial Secretary on disbursements from the Fund; (68 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary shall make a single grant of cash for each purpose advised by the Disaster Relief Fund Advisory Committee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary shall obtain the consent of the Finance Committee for a grant in excess of $8 million;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Finance Committee may amend the limit for which the Financial Secretary is required to obtain their consent;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the Financial Secretary shall credit to the Fund—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appropriations from the general revenue approved by the Legislative Council for the purpose of the Fund;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: donations received for the purpose of the Fund; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary may expend moneys from the Fund for the purpose of disaster relief as may be advised by the Disaster Relief Fund Advisory Committee;

paragraph.name: h
i
j
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary shall not transfer any moneys from the Fund to the general revenue.
